Trial_Design.evidence: patients undergoing hysteroscopic surgery at the affiliated hospital of North Sichuan Medical College were randomly divided into five groups

Participants.evidence: One hundred and fifty patients undergoing hysteroscopic surgery at the affiliated hospital of North Sichuan Medical College

Intervention.evidence: administered dexmedetomidine at a dose of 0.4 µg/kg, 0.6 µg/kg, 0.8 µg/kg, or 1.0 µg/kg, or saline

Method_Outcome.evidence: Hemodynamic parameters and adverse events related to anesthesia were also evaluated

Result_Outcome.evidence: The EC50 of propofol was significantly lower in the Dex 0.6, Dex 0.8, and Dex 1.0 groups compared to the S group ( p <0.05)

Harms.evidence: the incidence of respiratory depression decreased ( p <0.01). Nevertheless, the incidence of bradycardia slightly increased ( p =0.02)
